page.title: 09Norton Secondary School
page.content: The school opened in new buildings in 1963 on an open 15 acre site on the edge of Norton-on-Derwent. About half of the pupils come from the local primary school in Norton, the remainder being brought in school buses from village schools in Rillington,Langton,Settrington,West Heslerton,Leavening,Luttons and Weaverthorpe. The school has a fully comprehensive five-form entry and caters for pupils aged 11 to 16 years, sixth form education normally being provided at Malton School. On entering the school pupils join mixed ability house based Tutor Groups in which they normally remain for the rest of their school career. The four houses provide the basis for a wide range of school competitions including Drama and General Knowledge as well as the sports.(continued)
